project_name: Modular Panel Climbing Wall & ECO Frame
location: Daniel's MVP - 10 All Nations Drive, Brampton, ON, L7A 5G6
gravity_system: Modular Panel Climbing Wall, ECO Frames, Existing 2" Reinforced Concrete Slab on Grade
other_materials: Plywood Panels, Dewalt Power-Stud+ SD2 Anchors
structural_beams: HSS Monkey Bar Beams, HSS Cross Beams
key_elements: Climbing Wall, ECO Frame, Baseplate, Sleeve Anchors, Trussing Clamps
overall_building_description: The structural design of the Modular Panel Climbing Wall & ECO Frame project incorporates a variety of technical specifications and connection details to ensure stability and performance. The climbing wall is constructed using 3/4" thick plywood panels, secured with HILTI HLC-FPH sleeve anchors, which are Ã˜ 3/8" for 3/8"-2-7/8" with a minimum embedment of 1.5 inches, providing robust anchorage to the existing structure. The ECO frame utilizes HSS sections, including HSS3x2x0.1875, HSS2x2x0.1875, and HSS3x3x0.1875, forming the primary structural components. These sections are connected using KAD KB-1 trussing clamps, rated for a 500 kg capacity, ensuring lateral stability and effective load transfer. The connection details are meticulously designed, with stub beams and columns connected using A325 bolts, ensuring moment connections and shear transfer across the frame. The baseplate details specify the use of Dewalt Power-Stud+ SD2 anchors with a 3.25" embedment, critical for the foundation's load-bearing capacity. The reaction table outlines the unfactored loads and moments, with dead, live, and seismic loads detailed in kips and kip-ft, providing a comprehensive understanding of the forces acting on the structure. The assembly sequence involves precise alignment of HSS beams and columns, with trussing clamps installed as per manufacturer specifications, ensuring proper erection and stability. The spatial relationships are defined through section callouts, such as 1/S3 and 2/S4, which guide the integration of various components. The design adheres to specific code compliance notes, ensuring performance under seismic conditions, with ELX and ELY loads considered in the design criteria. Fabrication notes emphasize the use of 3/16" cap plates and SCH40 pipe for monkey bars, highlighting the importance of material grades and connection integrity. The construction details include joint configurations and reinforcement layouts, with emphasis on the use of sleeves and stub columns for enhanced structural integrity. The project also considers special conditions, such as the integration with existing structures, requiring careful coordination and alignment. Overall, the design reflects a comprehensive approach to structural engineering, with detailed specifications and rigorous attention to connection details, ensuring the climbing wall and ECO frame meet the required performance standards.
